body: Updated - dropped italics and changed mac OSX

Concept ACK.
Please take a look at [this](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/master/doc/files.md) for a better markdown table syntax

> s/Mac OSX/macOS/

@gapeman 
> ... and changed mac OSX

Sorry for being misunderstood. I mean use macOS name only. See: [release notes 0.18](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/release-notes/release-notes-0.18.0.md#compatibility).

Updated the table and macOS name.
Having troubles with squashing commits.

If it's possible to squash when merging, please do.

Please squash to one commit :-)

```
$ git checkout patch-2
$ git rebase -i HEAD~7
# mark all except first as "fixup"
$ git push -f
```

I had all sorts of problems when squashing. Following @practicalswift instructions did not go well.
head~7 was giving me last 12 commits or so, local branch was different from remote branch.
Anyway, i'm new to git so sorry for all the mess. All should be fine now.
I think everything was addressed and this is ready to be merged, unless people have more proposals.
LGTM

I took the liberty of adding one more line to the end of the file in the latest commit.
I myself was struggling to find _example bitcoin.conf_ file, so I think adding one more link to it might benefit someone.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.
Kindly asking for this PR to be merged, only 10 lines were changed. Thanks
ACK 1373fa7e3d3f04ce6938cdcd2124cba71ff82ca0
ACK

To achieve consistency between docs and the code base, may I suggest to remove Windows XP (< Vista) datadir path from this comment: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/adff8fe32101b2c007a85415c3ec565a7f137252/src/util/system.cpp#L686-L690 ?

It could be just
```
// Windows: C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Bitcoin
// macOS: ~/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin
...
```
Not sure about the Windows XP comment, I'll let the others chime in if they will.
I suppose we should merge the PR as it is.

diff_hunk:
@@ -49,4 +49,12 @@ rpcport=4000
 
 The configuration file is not automatically created; you can create it using your favorite text editor. By default, the configuration file name is `bitcoin.conf` and it is located in the Bitcoin data directory, but both the Bitcoin data directory and the configuration file path may be changed using the `-datadir` and `-conf` command-line options.
 
+### Default configuration file locations
+
+| Operating System | Data Directory | Path |
+| --- | --- | --- |
+| Windows | %APPDATA%\Bitcoin\ | *C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Bitcoin\bitcoin.conf* |
+| Linux | $HOME/.bitcoin/ | */home/username/.bitcoin/bitcoin.conf* |
+| Mac OSX | $HOME/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/ | */Users/username/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/bitcoin.conf* |
body: s/Mac OSX/macOS/

body:
I agree. We could just have `macOS | $HOME/Library/Application Support/Bitcoin/`.
Especially since `$HOME` and `/Users/username` etc are the same thing. Seems a bit confusing to be using both.

body: some people don't know what environment variables are. I think it's best if we leave both examples

diff_hunk:
@@ -50,3 +50,11 @@ rpcport=4000
 The configuration file is not automatically created; you can create it using your favorite text editor. By default, the configuration file name is `bitcoin.conf` and it is located in the Bitcoin data directory, but both the Bitcoin data directory and the configuration file path may be changed using the `-datadir` and `-conf` command-line options.
 
 The `includeconf=<file>` option in the `bitcoin.conf` file can be used to include additional configuration files.
+
+### Default configuration file locations
+
+Operating System | Data Directory | Example Path
+-- | -- | --
+Windows | %APPDATA%\Bitcoin\ | C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Bitcoin\bitcoin.conf
body: Please escape these paths using backtips e.g. `C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Bitcoin\bitcoin.conf`. I think this rendering is more appropriate, and also, otherwise, `'\x` will be seen as markdown escaping (this is why the letters have funky colors in the diff on github).

 The `includeconf=<file>` option in the `bitcoin.conf` file can be used to include additional configuration files.
+
+### Default configuration file locations
+

+-- | -- | --
+Windows | %APPDATA%\Bitcoin\ | C:\Users\username\AppData\Roaming\Bitcoin\bitcoin.conf
